name: touchily
content:

in a way that shows someone is easily offended or upset: Very firmly and touchily, he declined to comment. The parrot sat on the deck grumpily through the journey, remaining touchily unsociable. See
touchy
More examplesFewer examplesHe failed to score on his debut, something he seemed touchily aware of."You must ask my husband about that," she said touchily.He jingled the coins a moment in his palm, glancing at her touchily.
